alert.note: Alert for Cleburne; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:09PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Randolph and southeastern Cleburne Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 909 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Morrison Cross Roads, or 11 miles north of Wedowee, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ranburne, Woodland, Morrison Cross Roads, Fosters Cross Roads, Graham, Newell and Micaville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
